review: 这是我第一次给游戏差评　　我要亲手埋葬我的那个夏天

It's Overwatch 1.5. For a bonus for installing, you will get popups about how you should spend 35 dollars on a pack of mid skins for a character you don't play. Let's not forget to mention the pve segment was canned once they thought they could collect money from their awful battlepass system. Blizzard itself is a terrible company who molests their female employees. The only reason this game is alive is because of all the nsfw, and this game doesnt have a community tab yet, so it's basically dead on arrival on steam. Maybe if they fix their garbage business model instead of asking for someones life savings to have skins and gear they want, and bring the pve back to life, maybe it won't be such a shit fucking game.

i actually liked Overwatch a lot, still prefer TF2 but who gives a dam i like both. but im disliking this game to send a message as a person who has over 700 hours in this game, played since 2018 and is a grand masters torb player (if that makes my opinion matter more idk i thought it would be funny to mention) that this game got fucked up these past 2 years. im to lazy to explain why, i assure you the topic has been talked about to death do your own research. I really wanted that crazy PVE experience Jeff Kaplin desired. the future of this game is grim, but ill play it until it truly dies. if your new to this game, i dont see why you should not try the game its free now, dont fall for the crappy micro transaction and you might find joy in this game. i want to see Overwatch have a good future, but if the higher ups at Blizzard continue to be blind and brake promises (btw never trust gaming companies they are not your friends) this game is more doomed than a doomfist player

2500 hours of my life I poured into this game with over 1600 hours on my beloved Doomfist hero reaching Top 15 and feeling no accomplishment unlike when I reached 4.4k In OW1. I'm mentally drained from complaining about the state of the game Blizzard had so many chances and they ruined it every time. I'm not even going to go into detail about the stupid decisions this company has made over the last 3 years from balance to monetisation because its been said a million times before. I love OW I really do, I miss this game, the way it was, the T500 community and actual "Competitive" before it turned into casual. Im not wasting more time of my life caring about this game anymore. I'm always going to remember the good times I had and the friends I made playing Overwatch. GG Bliz

Eu joguei o Overwatch 1 a anos atras
Esse jogo é basicamente a mesma coisa que o 1? SIM.
Isso faz ele ruim? na MINHA opinião, Não.

Estou jogando a pouco tempo, então ainda não posso dar uma análise conclusiva, para logar precisa conectar a sua conta da battle.net, bem de boas, ele ficou de sincronizar a minha conta que joguei o Over 1 e ta lá a umas 4h já e nada, não consigo acessar várias funções e nem consigo abrir a loja, pelo que vi ta rolando uns bugs com a loja também, que eu imagino que devam ser arrumados em breve.

O jogo está rodando muito bem, está sendo algo divertido, quando arrumaram os problemas, com esse bom desempenho, creio que poderá se tornar um dos '' queridinhos '', eu particularmente estou curtindo.
Sou ruim? Sim
Vou continuar jogando? Sim 

E pra concluir, É GRÁTIS, o teste não vai custar nada, tire as suas próprias conclusões caso queira e bom jogo o/

[h1]The current state of the game is a shadow of its former self, marred by practices that do not favor the players.[/h1]

I have thousands of hours in Overwatch and reached GM in every role. Overwatch [b]was[/b] my favorite game of all time, but in the past few years, things have taken a bad turn.

Back in 2016, the game stood out to me with its fresh approach to the competitive shooter genre. My passion continued through my college years in 2018, where I even started to compete at the collegiate level. Though the balance was sometimes terrible (e.g., Goats, double shield, double sniper), I sensed a genuine effort and passion from the developers. However, with the announcement of Overwatch 2 and the PVE, my excitement was followed with skepticism - a skepticism that, unfortunately, has been justified.

The core of this game has been eroded by corporate greed, poor management, and decisions attributed to Bobby Kotick. Now free to play, Activision Blizzard appears determined to capitalize on every facet of the game, from battle passes to $15 PVE "missions," reselling old skins, charging for heroes, eliminating free loot boxes, and even undermining the vitality of the Overwatch League.

The current state of the game is a shadow of its former self, marred by practices that do not favor the players. I find myself unable to recommend Overwatch now or in the future, unless there is a monumental shift in Activision Blizzard's approach to become a company that values its community once again.
